oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pre-Columbian Panamanian tripod vessel
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chiriqui
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pre-Columbian tripod vessel with three hollow legs. Inside each leg is a free-floating ceramic ball, roughly 1 centimeter in diameter, visible through outward-facing vertical slits in each leg. The vessel base is narrow and rounded, with a wide body and shoulder. Rim is slightly constrictive. Bowl design may contain stylistic features of armadillo ware.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Antiquities, Prehistoric; Indians of Central America -- Antiquities; Indians of South America -- Antiquities
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: George and Louis Patten collection of Salem Hyde papers and cultural artifacts
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: George and Louise Patten collection of Salem Hyde cultural artifacts
